snippet: Nearly 90 percent of Americans said they were not aware of a “do not track” proposal that would let them opt out of having personal data collected for use in tailored ads.
abstract: Berkeley Center for Law and Technology survey finds nearly 90 percent of Americans are not aware of a Federal Trade Commission 'do not track' proposal that would let them opt out of having personal data collected for use in tailored advertisements; finds most do not find online ads useful.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 90 percent of Americans said they were not aware of a “do not track” proposal that would let them opt out of having personal data collected for use in tailored ads.

headline.seo: Most Americans Are Wary of Being Tracked Online, Study Says
headline.main: Study Finds Broad Wariness Over Online Tracking
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Broad Wariness Over Online Tracking
